00045 
00046 typedef bigfloat NT;
00047 
00048 //kurts custom dijkstra routine
00049 template<class NT>
00050 NT DIJKSTRA_T(const graph& G,                           //a graph
00051               node s,                                   //source node
00052               node t,                                   //sink node
00053               const edge_array<bool>& e_in_G,           //bool edge property is e in G
00054               const edge_array<NT>& cost,               //bigfloat edge property cost of the edges
00055               node_array<NT>& dist,                     //bigfoat node property distance
00056               node_array<edge>& pred) {                 //node property edge to predecessor
00057 
00058     node_pq<NT> PQ(G);                      //define a node priority queue
00059     PQ.insert(s,0);                         //insert s
00060 
00061     dist[s] = 0;                            //set the distance from s to s to 0
00062 
00063     node v;
00064     edge e;
00065     forall_nodes(v,G) pred[v] = nil;        //set all edges to predecessors to nil
00066 
00067     assert(s != t);                         //check for null path
00068 
00069     while ( !PQ.empty() ) {
00070 
00071         node u = PQ.del_min();
00072 
00073         forall_inout_edges(e,u) {
00074 
00075             if ( ! e_in_G[e] )
00076                 continue;
00077 
00078             node v = G.opposite(e,u);
00079             NT c = dist[u] + cost[e];
00080 
00081             if ( pred[v] == nil && v != s)
00082                 PQ.insert(v,c); // first path to v
00083 
00084             else if (c < dist[v])
00085                 PQ.decrease_p(v,c); // better path
00086 
00087             else
00088                 continue;
00089 
00090             dist[v] = c;
00091             pred[v] = e;
00092         }
00093     }
00094 
00095     return dist[t];
00096 }
00097 
00098 /*
00099 template<class NT>
00100 NT PH_DIJKSTRA_T(const graph& G, node s, node t,
00101                  const edge_array<NT>& cost,
00102                  const edge_array<NT> D,
00103                  node_array<NT>& dist,
00104                  node_array<edge>& pred) {
00105     node_pq<NT> PQ(G);
00106     PQ.insert(s,0);
00107 
00108     dist[s] = 0;
00109 
00110     node v;
00111     edge e;
00112     forall_nodes(v,G) pred[v] = nil;
00113 
00114     assert(s != t);
00115 
00116     int n = G.number_of_nodes();
00117 
00118     while ( !PQ.empty() ) {
00119         node u = PQ.del_min();
00120         forall_inout_edges(e,u) {
00121             if (D[e] < 4/(n*n)) continue;
00122             node v = G.opposite(e,u);
00123             NT c = dist[u] + cost[e];
00124             if ( pred[v] == nil && v != s)
00125                 PQ.insert(v,c); // first path to v
00126             else if (c < dist[v]) PQ.decrease_p(v,c); // better path
00127             else continue;
00128             dist[v] = c;
00129             pred[v] = e;
00130         }
00131     }
00132     assert(pred[t] != nil);
00133 
00134     return dist[t];
00135 
00136 }
00137 */
00138 
00139 template<class NT>
00140 bool DECOMPOSITION_DIJKSTRA_T(const graph& G, node s, node t,
00141                               const edge_array<NT>& L,
00142                               const edge_array<NT> Q,
00143                               node_array<NT>& dist,
00144                               node_array<edge>& pred,
00145                               NT eps) {
00146     node_pq<NT> PQ(G);
00147     PQ.insert(s,0);
00148 
00149     dist[s] = 0;
00150 
00151     node v;
00152     edge e;
00153     forall_nodes(v,G) pred[v] = nil;
00154 
00155 
00156     while ( !PQ.empty() ) {
00157         node u = PQ.del_min();
00158         forall_inout_edges(e,u) {
00159             if ( abs(Q[e]) < eps ) continue;
00160             node v = G.opposite(e,u);
00161             if ( ( Q[e] > 0 && u == G.target(e) ) || ( Q[e] < 0 && u == G.source(e) ) ) continue;
00162             NT c = dist[u] + L[e];
00163             if ( pred[v] == nil && v != s)
00164                 PQ.insert(v,c); // first path to v
00165             else if (c < dist[v]) PQ.decrease_p(v,c); // better path
00166             else continue;
00167             dist[v] = c;
00168             pred[v] = e;
00169         }
00170     }
00171 
00172 
00173     return ( pred[t] != nil );
00174 
00175 }
00176 
00177 /*
00178 //I am removing all edges from the graph whose conductance and flow is below a certain epsilon.
00179 //If all edges incident to a vertex are removed, I am also removing the vertex. If epsilon is less than
00180 //1/n it should never happen that I remove s or t
00181 //After pruning small edges, the graph my become disconnected. I should only keep the nodes that
00182 //are reachable from s
00183 void prune_graph(const graph& G, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& D, const edge_array<NT>& Q,
00184                  const edge_array<bool>& in_SP, edge_array<bool>& e_in_G,
00185                  node_array<bool>& v_in_G, int& n, int& m, NT epsilon)
00186 
00187 {
00188     node v;
00189     edge e;
00190     bool did_prune = false;
00191     forall_edges(e,G) {
00192         if ( ! e_in_G[e]) continue;   // e was previously removed
00193         if ( (abs(Q[e]) < epsilon) && (D[e] < epsilon)) {
00194             e_in_G[e] = false;
00195             m--;
00196             did_prune = true;
00197             //assert ( !in_SP[e] );
00198             if ( in_SP[e] ) std::cout << "\nremoved edge of shortest path";
00199             std::cout << "\nremoved edge";
00200         }
00201     }
00202     forall_nodes(v,G) {
00203         if ( ! v_in_G[v] ) continue;   // v was previously removed
00204         bool flag = false;
00205         forall_inout_edges(e,v) {
00206             if ( e_in_G[e] ) flag = true;
00207         }
00208         if ( flag == false ) {
00209             v_in_G[v] = false;
00210             n--;
00211             did_prune = true;
00212             std::cout << "\nremoved node";
00213         }
00214     }
00215 
00216     assert(v_in_G[s] && v_in_G[t]);
00217 
00218     node_array<bool> reachable(G,false);
00219     forall_nodes(v,G) reachable[v] = false;
00220     stack<node> R;
00221     R.push(s);
00222     reachable[s] = true;
00223     while ( ! R.empty() ) {
00224         v = R.pop();
00225         forall_inout_edges(e,v) {
00226             if ( ! e_in_G[e] ) continue;   // only use edges that are still present
00227             node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00228             if ( ! reachable[w] ) {
00229                 reachable[w] = true;
00230                 R.push(w);
00231             }
00232         }
00233     }
00234 
00235     forall_nodes(v,G) {
00236         if ( reachable[v] || ! v_in_G[v] ) continue;
00237         // v is still in graph, but not reachable, remove it and all incident edges;
00238         forall_inout_edges(e,v) {
00239             if ( ! e_in_G[e]) continue;   // e was previously removed
00240             e_in_G[e] = false;
00241             m--;
00242         }
00243         v_in_G[v] = false;
00244         n--;
00245         did_prune = true;
00246     }
00247     assert(v_in_G[s] && v_in_G[t]);
00248 
00249     if ( did_prune ) std::cout << "\n\nI am down to " << n << " nodes and " << m << " edges.";
00250 }
00251 */
00252

00255 void prune_graph_modified(const graph& G, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& D, const edge_array<NT>& Q,
00256                           const edge_array<bool>& in_SP, edge_array<bool>& e_in_G,
00257                           node_array<bool>& v_in_G, int& n, int& m) {
00258     node v;
00259     edge e;
00260     bool did_prune = false;
00261 
00262     node_array<bool> reachable(G,false);
00263     forall_nodes(v,G) reachable[v] = false;
00264     stack<node> R;
00265     R.push(s);
00266     reachable[s] = true;
00267     while ( ! R.empty() ) {
00268         v = R.pop();
00269         forall_inout_edges(e,v) {
00270             if ( ! e_in_G[e] ) continue;   // only use edges that are still present
00271             node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00272             if ( ! reachable[w] ) {
00273                 reachable[w] = true;
00274                 R.push(w);
00275             }
00276         }
00277     }
00278 
00279     forall_nodes(v,G) {
00280         if ( reachable[v] || ! v_in_G[v] ) continue;
00281         // v is still in graph, but not reachable, remove it and all incident edges;
00282         forall_inout_edges(e,v) {
00283             if ( ! e_in_G[e]) continue;   // e was previously removed
00284             e_in_G[e] = false;
00285             m--;
00286         }
00287         v_in_G[v] = false;
00288         n--;
00289         did_prune = true;
00290     }
00291     assert(v_in_G[s] && v_in_G[t]);
00292 
00293     if ( did_prune ) std::cout << "\n\nI am down to " << n << " nodes and " << m << " edges.";
00294 }
00295 */
00296 
00297 /*
00298 //I am computing the potentials. I am restricting
00299 //myself to the network of edges and vertices that are still present. In order to connect vertices to indices,
00300 //I number the nodes that are still present.
00301 //I am setting up a dangerous system as all row sums are equal to zero, except for the row corresponding to t.
00302 //Maybe the system becomes more stable, if I give node t the number one.
00303 void initialize_potentials_old(const graph& G, int n, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00304                    const edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, const node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00305                   edge_array<NT>& D, edge_array<NT>& Q, node_array<NT>& p, NT epsilon)  {
00306 
00307 matrix M(n,n); vector b(n);
00308   node v; edge e;
00309   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00310   { b[i] = 0;
00311     for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) M(i,j) = 0;
00312   }
00313   node_array<int> num(G);
00314   num[t] = 0;
00315   int count = 1;
00316   forall_nodes(v,G) { if ( v_in_G[v] && v != t ) num[v] = count++; }
00317   assert(count == n);
00318 
00319 for every node v different from t, I am generating the equation corresponding to flow conservation.
00320 The right hand side is zero, except for s, where it is I0, the desired flow from s to t.
00321 For t, I am generating the equation, p[t] = 0
00322   forall_nodes(v,G)
00323   { if ( ! v_in_G[v] ) continue;
00324     int i = num[v];
00325     if ( v == t ) { M(i,i) = 1; b[i] = 0; }
00326     else
00327     { NT S = 0;
00328       forall_inout_edges(e,v)
00329       { if ( ! e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00330         node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00331         assert( ! (v == w)); // no self-loops
00332         M(i,num[w]) = -D[e]/L[e];
00333         S += D[e]/L[e];
00334       }
00335       M(i,i) = S;
00336       if ( v == s ) b[i] = I0;
00337     }
00338   }
00339   vector p0(n);
00340   p0 = M.solve(b);
00341   forall_nodes(v,G) if ( v_in_G[v] ) p[v] = p0[num[v]];
00342 }
00343 
00344 */
00345 
00346 /*
00347 //I am computing the potentials and the flows and then update the conductances. I am restricting
00348 //myself to the network of edges and vertices that are still present. In order to connect vertices to indices,
00349 //I number the nodes that are still present.
00350 //I am setting up a dangerous system as all row sums are equal to zero, except for the row corresponding to t.
00351 //Maybe the system becomes more stable, if I give node t the number one.
00352 void one_iteration(const graph& G, int n, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00353                    const edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, const node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00354                   edge_array<NT>& D, edge_array<NT>& Q, node_array<NT>& p, NT epsilon){
00355 
00356                       matrix M(n,n); vector b(n);
00357   node v; edge e;
00358   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
00359   { b[i] = 0;
00360     for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) M(i,j) = 0;
00361   }
00362   node_array<int> num(G);
00363   num[t] = 0;
00364   int count = 1;
00365   forall_nodes(v,G) { if ( v_in_G[v] && v != t ) num[v] = count++; }
00366   assert(count == n);
00367 
00368 for every node v different from t, I am generating the equation corresponding to flow conservation.
00369 The right hand side is zero, except for s, where it is I0, the desired flow from s to t.
00370 For t, I am generating the equation, p[t] = 0
00371   forall_nodes(v,G)
00372   { if ( ! v_in_G[v] ) continue;
00373     int i = num[v];
00374     if ( v == t ) { M(i,i) = 1; b[i] = 0; }
00375     else
00376     { NT S = 0;
00377       forall_inout_edges(e,v)
00378       { if ( ! e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00379         node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00380         assert( ! (v == w)); // no self-loops
00381         M(i,num[w]) = -D[e]/L[e];
00382         S += D[e]/L[e];
00383       }
00384       M(i,i) = S;
00385       if ( v == s ) b[i] = I0;
00386     }
00387   }
00388   vector p0(n);
00389   p0 = M.solve(b);
00390   forall_nodes(v,G) if ( v_in_G[v] ) p[v] = p0[num[v]];
00391   forall_edges(e,G) if ( e_in_G[e] ) Q[e] = (D[e]/L[e])*(p0[num[G.source(e)]] - p0[num[G.target(e)]]);
00392   forall_edges(e,G) if ( e_in_G[e] )
00393    { D[e] = D[e] + epsilon*(abs(Q[e]) - D[e]);  if (D[e] < 0 ) D[e] = 0; }
00394 }
00395 */
00396 
00397 
00398 //I am computing the potentials. I am restricting
00399 //myself to the network of edges and vertices that are still present. In order to connect vertices to indices,
00400 //I number the nodes that are still present.
00401 //I am setting up a dangerous system as all row sums are equal to zero, except for the row corresponding to t.
00402 //Maybe the system becomes more stable, if I give node t the number one.
00403 void initialize_potentials(const graph& G, int& n, int& m, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00404                            edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00405                            edge_array<NT>& D, edge_array<NT>& Q, node_array<NT>& p, NT epsilon){
00406     node v;
00407     edge e;
00408     forall_nodes(v,G) p[v] = 0;
00409 
00410     while ( true ) {
00411 
00412         NT maxdiff = 0;
00413         forall_nodes(v,G) {
00414 
00415             if ( (! v_in_G[v]) || v == t ) continue;  // p[t] = 0 always
00416 
00417                 NT S = 0;
00418                 NT R = 0;
00419 
00420                 forall_inout_edges(e,v) {
00421 
00422                     if ( ! e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00423 
00424                         node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00425                         assert( ! (v == w)); // no self-loops
00426                         NT g = D[e]/L[e];
00427                         if ( g < epsilon ) {
00428                             e_in_G[e] = false;
00429                             m--;
00430                             continue;
00431                         }
00432 
00433                     R += g * p[w];
00434                     S += g;
00435                 }
00436 
00437                 if ( v == s ) R += I0;
00438                 if ( S == 0 ) continue;
00439                 /*{ v_in_G[v] = false; n--;
00440                   forall_inout_edges(e,v)
00441                     if ( e_in_G[e] ) { e_in_G[e] = false; m--; }
00442                 }
00443                 */
00444                 else {
00445 
00446                     NT oldp = p[v];
00447                     p[v] = R/S;
00448                     if ( abs(p[v] - oldp) > maxdiff ) maxdiff = abs(p[v] - oldp);
00449                 }
00450         }
00451         if (maxdiff < epsilon) break;
00452     }
00453 }
00454 
00455 NT normalized_cost(const graph& G, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00456                    edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00457                    edge_array<NT>& D, node_array<NT>& p, NT MC) {
00458     node v;
00459     edge e;
00460 
00461     NT C = 0;
00462     NT SD = 0;
00463 
00464     forall_edges(e,G) {
00465         if ( ! e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00466         C += D[e] * L[e];
00467     }
00468     return C/MC;
00469 }
00470 
00471 //At first, I computed the maximum diameter of an edge not on the shortest path. This function does not always decrease and I should not have expected it. Even for the case of three
00472 //links it does not. In the three-links demo, the diameter of the middle edge goes up first and
00473 //the goes down.
00474 //
00475 //I therefore modified the function. I now compute the ratio of largest diameter off the shortest path divided by minimum diameter on the shortest path.
00476 NT max_ratio(const graph& G, const edge_array<bool>& in_SP,
00477              const edge_array<bool>& e_in_G,
00478              const edge_array<NT>& D, NT MC)
00479 
00480 {
00481     node v;
00482     edge e;
00483 
00484     NT MAX_NOT_IN_SP = 0;
00485     NT MIN_IN_SP = 50*I0;   // hack
00486 
00487     forall_edges(e,G) {
00488         assert(e_in_G[e]);
00489         if ( in_SP[e] && ( D[e] < MIN_IN_SP ) ) MIN_IN_SP = D[e];
00490         if ( !in_SP[e] && ( D[e] >  MAX_NOT_IN_SP ) ) MAX_NOT_IN_SP = D[e];
00491     }
00492     return MAX_NOT_IN_SP/MIN_IN_SP;
00493 }
00494 
00495 /*
00496 NT MinCutWheatStone(const graph& G, const edge_array<NT>& D, edge e1, edge e2, edge e3, edge e4, edge e5) {
00497     NT C1 = D[e1] + D[e3];
00498     NT C2 = D[e2] + D[e5] + D[e3];
00499     NT C3 = D[e1] + D[e5] + D[e4];
00500     NT C4 = D[e2] + D[e4];
00501     return min(min(C1,C2),min(C3,C4));
00502 }
00503 */
00504 
00505 NT MinCut(const graph& G, const edge_array<NT>& D, const edge_array<bool>& in_SP, node s, node t) {
00506 
00507 
00508 //    edge_array<integer> f(G);                         //this line makes the debugger cry
00509 
00510     edge_array<int> f(G);
00511 
00512     NT Large = 1;
00513     for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) Large = 2*Large;
00514 //    edge_array<integer> DI(G);                        //this line makes the debugger cry
00515     edge_array<int> DI(G);
00516     edge e;
00517     NT MIND = 0;
00518     forall_edges(e,G) {
00519         if ( in_SP[e] && ( MIND == 0 || D[e] < MIND )) MIND = D[e];
00520 //        DI[e] = floor(D[e]*Large);
00521         DI[e] = floor(D[e]*Large).to_double() ;         //ugly fix: fist convert to double and then implicitely convert to int
00522     }
00523     NT F = bigfloat(MAX_FLOW_T(G,s,t,DI,f))/Large;
00524     if ( F < MIND - 1 ) {
00525         std::cout << "\n\n Oberfaul" << MIND << " " << F << " " << Large;
00526         forall_edges(e,G) std::cout << "\n" << D[e] << " " << DI[e];
00527         exit(1);
00528     }
00529     return F;
00530 }
00531 
00532 /*
00533 //I decompose the flow; I assume that the node potentials correspond to the current D-values
00534 //The flow induces an acyclic graph. I compose the flow into paths, by iteratively computing a shortest
00535 //s-t path and then routing as much flow as possible on this path. I return the quantity
00536 //                    sum_P  flow(P)/length(P).
00537 //The conjecture is that this quantity goes down. Did I verify this for parallel links?
00538 NT flow_decomposition(const graph& G, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00539                       edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00540                       edge_array<NT>& D, node_array<NT>& p, NT epsilon) {
00541     edge_array<NT> Q(G);
00542 
00543     node v;
00544     edge e;
00545     forall_edges(e,G) {
00546         if ( !e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00547         Q[e] = (D[e]/L[e])*(p[G.source(e)] - p[G.target(e)]);
00548     }
00549 
00550     NT NFS = 0;   // normalized flow sum
00551 
00552     node_array<NT> dist(G);
00553     node_array<edge> pred(G);
00554 
00555     while ( DECOMPOSITION_DIJKSTRA_T(G, s, t, L, Q, dist, pred, epsilon) ) {
00556         NT maxflow = I0;
00557         NT TotalResistance = 0;
00558         node v = t;
00559         while ( v != s ) {
00560             edge e = pred[v];
00561             if ( abs(Q[e]) < maxflow ) maxflow = abs(Q[e]);
00562             TotalResistance += L[e]*log(D[e].to_double());
00563             v = G.opposite(e,v);
00564         }
00565 
00566         NFS += maxflow * TotalResistance;
00567 
00568         v = t;
00569         while ( v != s ) {
00570             edge e = pred[v];
00571             Q[e] += ( Q[e] < 0 ? maxflow : -maxflow );
00572             v = G.opposite(e,v);
00573         }
00574     }
00575     return NFS;
00576 }
00577 */
00578 
00579 
00580 /*
00581 
00582 */
00583 void statistics_on_changes(const graph& G, int& n, int& m, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00584                            edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00585                            edge_array<NT>& D, edge_array<NT>& Q, node_array<NT>& p, NT epsilon,
00586                            edge_array<int>& number_of_changes, const edge_array<NT>& predicted_rate)    {
00587     //dictionary<int,list<edge> > ordered_changes;
00588     edge e;
00589     forall_edges(e,G)
00590     if ( number_of_changes[e] > 0 ) {
00591         std::cout << "\n\nnumber of changes" << number_of_changes[e] << "  predicted_rate = " << predicted_rate[e];
00592     }
00593     return;
00594 }
00595 
00596 
00597 //I
00598 //-- compute the flows
00599 //-- update the conductivities
00600 //-- update the potentials
00601 NT update(const graph& G, int& n, int& m, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00602           edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00603           edge_array<NT>& D, edge_array<NT>& Q, node_array<NT>& p, NT epsilon,
00604           edge_array<int>& number_of_changes, const edge_array<NT>& predicted_rate, int& max_number_of_changes, edge& max_edge) {
00605     NT oldSum = 0;
00606     NT newSum = 0;
00607 
00608     node v;
00609     edge e;
00610     forall_edges(e,G) {
00611 
00612         if ( !e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00613 
00614         NT oldflow = Q[e];
00615 
00616         Q[e] = (D[e]/L[e])*(p[G.source(e)] - p[G.target(e)]);  //this is it
00617 
00618 
00619         if ( oldflow*Q[e] < 0 ) {
00620 
00621             number_of_changes[e]++;
00622 
00623             std::cout << "\n\nnumber of changes is now = " << number_of_changes[e] << " predicted rate = " << predicted_rate[e];
00624 
00625             if ( number_of_changes[e] > max_number_of_changes ) {
00626 
00627                 max_number_of_changes++;
00628                 max_edge = e;
00629                 std::cout << "\n NEX MAX ";
00630             }
00631         }
00632 
00633         oldSum += abs(Q[e])*L[e];
00634         D[e] = D[e] + 0.1*(abs(Q[e]) - D[e]);
00635         if (D[e] < 0 ) D[e] = 0;
00636     }
00637 
00638     node_array<NT> old_p(G);
00639     forall_nodes(v,G) old_p[v] = p[v];
00640 
00641     while ( true ) {
00642         NT maxdiff = 0;
00643         forall_nodes(v,G) {
00644             if ( (! v_in_G[v]) || v == t ) continue;  // p[t] = 0 always
00645             NT S = 0;
00646             NT R = 0;
00647             forall_inout_edges(e,v) {
00648                 if ( ! e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00649                 node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00650                 assert( ! (v == w)); // no self-loops
00651                 NT g = D[e]/L[e];
00652                 //if ( g < epsilon ) { e_in_G[e] = false; m--; continue; }
00653                 R += g * p[w];
00654                 S += g;
00655             }
00656             if ( v == s ) R += I0;
00657             if ( S == 0 ) continue;
00658             /*
00659             { v_in_G[v] = false; n--;
00660               forall_inout_edges(e,v)
00661                 if ( e_in_G[e] ) { e_in_G[e] = false; m--; }
00662             }
00663             else
00664             */
00665             {
00666                 NT oldp = p[v];
00667                 p[v] = R/S;
00668                 if ( abs(p[v] - oldp) > maxdiff ) maxdiff = abs(p[v] - oldp);
00669             }
00670         }
00671         if (maxdiff < epsilon) break;
00672     }
00673 
00674 
00675     /*
00676     forall_edges(e,G)
00677     { if ( !e_in_G[e] ) continue;
00678       Q[e] = (D[e]/L[e])*(p[G.source(e)] - p[G.target(e)]);
00679       newSum += abs(Q[e])*L[e];
00680     }
00681     if (newSum >= oldSum + 100*epsilon ) { std::cout << "\n\n\nCONJECTURE IS FALSE\nold sum and new sum =" << oldSum << " " << newSum; leda::wait(1.0); }
00682     */
00683 
00684 
00685 
00686     NT max_diff = 0;
00687     forall_nodes(v,G)
00688     if ( abs(old_p[v] - p[v]) > max_diff ) max_diff = abs(old_p[v] - p[v]);
00689     return max_diff;
00690 }
00691 
00692 //I
00693 //-- compare the computed potential with the predicted potentials
00694 bool post_mortem_analysis(const graph& G, int n, int m, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00695                           const edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, const node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00696                           const edge_array<NT>& D, const edge_array<NT>& Q,
00697                           const node_array<NT>& p, const node_array<NT>& predicted_p,
00698                           const edge_array<NT>& predicted_rate, NT max_diff) {
00699     node v;
00700     edge e;
00701     int count = 0;
00702     forall_nodes(v,G) {
00703         std::cout << "\npredicted and actual potentials: " << predicted_p[v] << " " << p[v];
00704         if ( v == t || predicted_p[v] < 0 || (abs(p[v] - predicted_p[v])/p[v] < max_diff) ) count++;
00705     }
00706 
00707     std::cout << "\n\nnumber of nodes for which predicted and actual potential agree " << count << " out of " << n;
00708 
00709     int countm = 0;
00710     forall_edges(e,G) {
00711         NT Qcurrent = abs(D[e]/L[e] *(p[G.target(e)] - p[G.source(e)]));
00712         double measured_rate = (Qcurrent/D[e] - 1).to_double();
00713         double predicted_r = predicted_rate[e].to_double();
00714         std::cout << "\n\nconductances " << D[e] << " flow " << Qcurrent << " predicted rate " << predicted_r << " measured_rate " << measured_rate;
00715         if ( abs(predicted_r - measured_rate) < max_diff ) countm++;
00716     }
00717     std::cout << "\n\nnumber of edges for which predicted and actual agree " << countm << " out of " << m;
00718 
00719     return ( count == n && countm == m);
00720 }
00721 
00722 
00723 /*
00724 bool predict_potentials_first_try(const graph& G, int n, int m, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
00725                                   edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
00726                                   const edge_array<NT>& D, const edge_array<NT>& Q,
00727                                   const node_array<NT>& p, node_array<NT>& predicted_p,
00728                                   edge_array<bool>& in_SP,
00729                                   node_array<NT>& dists, node_array<edge>& preds,
00730                                   node_array<NT>& distt, node_array<edge>& predt, NT& D_st)
00731 // I predict the potentials
00732 //-- If t is not reachable from s I return 0, otherwise, I return the number of edges in the shortest
00733 //path from s to t
00734 //-- first I compute shortest path distances from s and t, respectively
00735 //-- nodes that are not reachable
00736 
00737 {
00738     node v;
00739     edge e;
00740     forall_nodes(v,G) {
00741         v_in_G[v] = true;
00742         dists[v] = distt[v] = predicted_p[v] = 0;
00743     }
00744     forall_edges(e,G) {
00745         e_in_G[e] = true;
00746         in_SP[e] = false;
00747     }
00748 
00749     D_st = DIJKSTRA_T(G, s, t, e_in_G, L, dists, preds);
00750 
00751     if (preds[t] == nil) return 0;
00752 
00753 //    I am checking that the shortest path from s to t is unique and I am marking all edges
00754 //    on the shortest path.
00755 //    The shortest path is unique if for every vertex on the shortest path there is only one incoming edge
00756 //    that defines the distance of the node
00757 
00758     int m_SP = 0;
00759 
00760     v = t;
00761     while ( v != s) {
00762         edge e = preds[v];
00763         m_SP++;
00764         in_SP[e] = true;
00765         node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00766         edge f;
00767         forall_inout_edges(f,v) {
00768             if ( f == e) continue;
00769             node z = G.opposite(f,v);
00770             if ( dists[z] + L[f] == dists[v]) return 0;
00771         }
00772         v = w;
00773     }
00774 // t is reachable from s and the shortest path from s to t is unique
00775 
00776     std::cout << "\n\nThe shortest s-t path consists of " << m_SP << " edges and has length " << D_st;
00777 
00778     DIJKSTRA_T(G, t, s, e_in_G, L, distt, predt);  // distances from $t$
00779 
00780     assert( distt[s] == D_st );
00781 
00782     forall_nodes(v,G) predicted_p[v] = 0;
00783 
00784 // I first assign potentials to the nodes on the shortest path from s to t
00785     v = t;
00786     while ( v != s) {
00787         edge e = preds[v];
00788         assert(in_SP[e]);
00789         node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00790         predicted_p[w] = predicted_p[v] + L[e];
00791         v = w;
00792     }
00793     assert(predicted_p[s] == D_st);
00794 
00795 
00796 
00797     NT current_dist = D_st;
00798 
00799     while (true) {
00800         NT smallest_new_dist = 100000;
00801         node newnode = nil;
00802 
00803         forall_nodes(v,G) std::cout << "\nnode = " << v << " predicted potential " << predicted_p[v] << " sum of distances = " << distt[v] + dists[v];
00804 
00805 
00806         forall_nodes(v,G) {
00807             NT sum = distt[v] + dists[v];  // sum == 0 means not reachable
00808             if ( sum == 0 || sum < current_dist || v == t || predicted_p[v] != 0 ) continue;
00809             if ( sum < smallest_new_dist ) {
00810                 smallest_new_dist = sum;
00811                 newnode = v;
00812             }
00813         }
00814 
00815         current_dist = smallest_new_dist;
00816 
00817         std::cout << "\nnew current dist = " << current_dist << " new node = " << newnode;
00818 
00819 // the nodes on the shortest s-t path via newnode are assigned their potentials.
00820 
00821         if ( newnode == nil ) return m_SP;
00822 
00823         NT Lsum = 0;
00824 
00825         v = newnode;
00826 
00827 // walk towards s
00828 
00829         while ( predicted_p[v] == 0 && v != s ) {
00830             edge e = preds[v];
00831             node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00832             Lsum += L[e];
00833             v = w;
00834         }
00835 
00836         NT pot_high = predicted_p[v];
00837 
00838 // walks towards t
00839         stack<edge> ES;
00840         v = newnode;
00841         while ( predicted_p[v] == 0 && v != t ) {
00842             edge e = predt[v];
00843             ES.push(e);
00844             node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00845             Lsum += L[e];
00846             v = w;
00847         }
00848 
00849 
00850         NT pot_low = predicted_p[v];
00851 
00852         NT pot_diff = pot_high - pot_low;
00853 
00854         std::cout << "\nnew potdiff  = " << pot_diff  << " length  = " << Lsum;
00855 
00856 // Lsum is the length of the new path
00857 
00858 // v has a predicted potential and v is on the path from newnode to t
00859 
00860         while ( ! ES.empty() ) {
00861             e = ES.pop();
00862             node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00863             predicted_p[w] = predicted_p[v] + pot_diff * L[e]/Lsum;
00864             std::cout << " L[e] = " << L[e];
00865             v = w;
00866         }
00867 
00868         assert(v == newnode);
00869 
00870         while (true) {
00871             edge e = preds[v];
00872             node w = G.opposite(e,v);
00873             if ( predicted_p[w] != 0 ) break;
00874             predicted_p[w] = predicted_p[v] + pot_diff * L[e]/Lsum;
00875             std::cout << " L[e] = " << L[e];
00876             v = w;
00877         }
00878 
00879     } // end while true
00880 
00881 }
00882 */
00883 
00890 int predict_potentials(const GRAPH<int,double>& G,      //a bidirected graph
00891                        int n,                           //number of nodes
00892                        int m,                           //number of edges
00893                        node s,                          //source of the path
00894                        node t,                          //sink of the path
00895                        const edge_array<NT>& L,         //edge property edge length
00896                        edge_array<bool>& e_in_G,        //edge property edge in the graph
00897                        node_array<bool>& v_in_G,        //node property node in the graph
00898                        const edge_array<NT>& D,         //edge property edge diameter
00899                        const edge_array<NT>& Q,         //edge property edge flux
00900                        const node_array<NT>& p,         //node property node potential
00901                        node_array<NT>& predicted_p,     //node property predicted node potential
00902                        edge_array<bool>& in_SP,         //edge property edge in_SP
00903                        NT& D_st,                        //bigfloat distance(s,t)
00904                        edge_array<NT>& predicted_rate)  //edge property edge predicted rate
00905 {
00906 
00907     edge e;                         //dummy edge that faciliates iteration over all edges in forall_edges
00908     node v;                         //dummy node that faciliates iteration over all nodes in forall_nodes
00909 
00910     forall_nodes(v,G) {
00911         v_in_G[v] = true;           //reset all nodes to be part of the graph
00912         predicted_p[v] = -1;        //reset the predicted potentials to -1 for all nodes, i.e. not processed
00913     }
00914 
00915     forall_edges(e,G) {
00916         e_in_G[e] = true;               //reset all edges to be part of the graph
00917         in_SP[e] = false;               //reset all edges to not be part of the graph
00918         predicted_rate[e] = -1;         //reset the predicted potentials to -1 for all edges, i.e. not processed
00919     }
00920 
00921     node_array<NT> dist(G);                 //define a bigfloat node property distance for G
00922     node_array<edge>   pred(G,nil);         //define a node property of type edge initialized to nil for G
00923     edge_array<bool>   used(G,false);       //define a bool edge property initialized to false for G
00924 
00925     forall_edges(e,G) assert(used[e] == false);     //check wether all edges are unused
00926     forall_nodes(v,G) assert(pred[v] == nil);       //check wether all nodes do not have a pred edge
00927 
00928 
00929     // D_st == distance(s,t)
00930     D_st = DIJKSTRA_T(  G,              //graph
00931                         s,              //start of the path
00932                         t,              //end of the path
00933                         e_in_G,         //are the nodes in G?
00934                         L,              //length of the paths == cost of the path
00935                         dist,           //will hold the distances computed
00936                         pred);          //will hold a list of edges to the predecessor of a certain node
00937 
00938 
00939 
00940     if (pred[t] == nil) {               //if the sink has no edge leading to a predecessor, it cannot be reached from the source
00941         return 0;
00942     }
00943 
00949     int m_SP = 0;               //number of edges in the shortes path
00950 
00951     v = t;
00952     predicted_p[t] = 0;         //set the sink potential
00953 
00954     while ( v != s) {           //as long as we havent reached the source
00955 
00956         edge e = pred[v];                       //fetch the edge leading to the predecessor node
00957         m_SP++;                                 //increase the number of edges in the shortest path
00958 
00959         in_SP[e] = true;                        //remember that we've visited this edge
00960         in_SP[G.reverse(e)] = true;             //and dont forget to mark its reversed edge
00961 
00962         predicted_rate[e] = 0;                  //since the edge is connected to the sink, the potential must be 0
00963         predicted_rate[G.reverse(e)] = 0;       //the same goes for the reversed edge
00964 
00965         used[e] = true;                         //e has been processed
00966         used[G.reverse(e)] = true;              //so has its reversed counterpart
00967 
00968         node w = G.opposite(e,v);                   //fetch the actual predecessor node
00969         predicted_p[w] = predicted_p[v] + L[e];     //here the potential changes according the length of the connecting edge
00970 
00971 
00972         edge f;                                     //iteration dummy
00973         forall_inout_edges(f,v) {
00974 
00975             if ( f == e || (G.reverse(e) != nil && f == G.reverse(e)) )
00976                 continue;
00977 
00978             node z = G.opposite(f,v);
00979 
00980             if ( dist[z] + L[f] == dist[v]) {                   //if i can take a detour from the determined shortest path that does not exceed its length
00981 
00982                 std::cout << "\nshortest path is not unique";
00983                 return 0;
00984             }
00985         }
00986 
00987         v = w;                                      //proceed from this node which is in a shortest path
00988     }
00989 
00990 
00991     std::cout << "\n\nThe shortest s-t path consists of " << m_SP << " edges and has length " << D_st;
00992 
01000     while (true) {
01001         // I am continuing until all nodes are predicted
01002 
01003         NT largest_ratio = 0;
01004         node    start_node = nil,
01005                 goal_node = nil;
01006 
01007         forall_nodes(v,G) {
01008 
01009             if ( predicted_p[v] < 0 )
01010                 continue;
01011 
01012             // v is predicted and I am starting a shortest path computation
01013 
01014             node_pq<NT> PQ(G);
01015 
01016             PQ.insert(v,0);
01017             dist[v] = 0;
01018 
01019             node u;
01020             edge e;
01021             forall_nodes(u,G) pred[u] = nil;
01022 
01023             while ( !PQ.empty() ) {
01024 
01025                 node u = PQ.del_min();
01026 
01027                 if ( u != v && predicted_p[u] >= 0 ) {
01028 
01029                     NT pot_diff = abs(predicted_p[u] - predicted_p[v]);
01030 
01031                     if ( pot_diff/dist[u] > largest_ratio ) {
01032                         start_node = v;
01033                         goal_node = u;
01034                         largest_ratio = pot_diff/dist[u];
01035                     }
01036 
01037                     continue;
01038                 }
01039 
01040                 forall_inout_edges(e,u) {
01041 
01042                     if ( used[e] )
01043                         continue;
01044 
01045                     node z = G.opposite(e,u);
01046                     NT c = dist[u] + L[e];
01047 
01048                     if ( pred[z] == nil && z != s)
01049                         PQ.insert(z,c);         // first path to v
01050 
01051                     else if (c < dist[z])
01052                         PQ.decrease_p(z,c);     // better path
01053 
01054                     else
01055                         continue;
01056 
01057                     dist[z] = c;
01058                     pred[z] = e;
01059                 }
01060             }
01061         }
01062 
01066         if ( start_node == nil ) {
01067             return m_SP;
01068             break;
01069         }
01070 
01071         {
01072             v = start_node;
01073 
01074             node_pq<NT> PQ(G);
01075 
01076 
01077 
01078             PQ.insert(v,0);
01079             dist[v] = 0;
01080 
01081             node u;
01082             edge e;
01083             forall_nodes(u,G) pred[u] = nil;
01084 
01085             while ( !PQ.empty() ) {
01086 
01087                 node u = PQ.del_min();
01088                 if ( u == goal_node )
01089                     break;
01090 
01091                 forall_inout_edges(e,u) {
01092 
01093                     if ( used[e] )
01094                         continue;
01095 
01096                     node z = G.opposite(e,u);
01097                     NT c = dist[u] + L[e];
01098 
01099                     if ( pred[z] == nil && z != s)
01100                         PQ.insert(z,c);                         // first path to v
01101 
01102                     else if (c < dist[z])
01103                         PQ.decrease_p(z,c);   // better path
01104 
01105                     else
01106                         continue;
01107 
01108                     dist[z] = c;
01109                     pred[z] = e;
01110                 }
01111             }
01112         }
01113 
01114         NT Lsum = dist[goal_node];
01115 
01118         NT pot_diff = predicted_p[start_node] - predicted_p[goal_node]; // may be positive or negative
01119 
01120         v = goal_node; //std::cout <<"\nnew path of length " << Lsum << " from " << G[goal_node];
01121         while (true) {
01122             edge e = pred[v];
01123             predicted_rate[e] = predicted_rate[G.reverse(e)] = abs(pot_diff)/Lsum - 1;
01124             used[e] = used[G.reverse(e)] = true;
01125             node w = G.opposite(e,v); //std::cout << " via " << G[w];
01126             if ( w == start_node ) break;
01127             predicted_p[w] = predicted_p[v] + pot_diff * L[e]/Lsum;
01128             v = w;
01129         }
01130 
01131     }
01132 //std::cout << "\n\n";
01133 }
01134 
01135 
01136 bool is_on_path(const GRAPH<int,double>& G, node w, const list<edge>& path) {
01137     edge e;
01138     forall(e,path) {
01139         if ( w == G.source(e) || w == G.target(e) )
01140             return true;
01141     }
01142     return false;
01143 }
01144 
01145 void construct_all_simple_paths(const GRAPH<int,double>& G, const edge_array<NT>& L, node t, node end_point,
01146                                 NT current_length,
01147                                 const list<edge>& path, list<simple_path>& all_simple_paths) {
01148     if ( end_point == t ) all_simple_paths.append(simple_path(current_length,t,path));
01149     edge e;
01150     forall_inout_edges(e,end_point) {
01151         node w = G.opposite(e,end_point);
01152         if ( is_on_path(G,w,path) ) continue;
01153         list<edge> new_path = path;
01154         new_path.append(e);
01155         construct_all_simple_paths(G,L,t,w,current_length + L[e],new_path,all_simple_paths);
01156     }
01157 }
01158 
01159 /*
01160 //I predict the potentials
01161 //-- If t is not reachable from s I return 0, otherwise, I return the number of edges in the shortest
01162 //path from s to t
01163 //-- first I compute shortest path distances from s and t, respectively
01164 //-- nodes that are not reachable
01165 int predict_potentials_third_try(const GRAPH<int,double>& G, int n, int m, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
01166                                  edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
01167                                  const edge_array<NT>& D, const edge_array<NT>& Q,
01168                                  const node_array<NT>& p, node_array<NT>& predicted_p,
01169                                  edge_array<bool>& in_SP, NT& D_st) {
01170     node v;
01171     edge e;
01172     forall_nodes(v,G) {
01173         v_in_G[v] = true;
01174         predicted_p[v] = -1;
01175     }
01176     forall_edges(e,G) {
01177         e_in_G[e] = true;
01178         in_SP[e] = false;
01179     }
01180 
01181     node_array<NT> dist(G);
01182     node_array<edge>   pred(G,nil);
01183     edge_array<bool>   used(G,false);
01184 
01185     forall_edges(e,G) assert(used[e] == false);
01186 
01187 
01188     D_st = DIJKSTRA_T(G, s, t, e_in_G, L, dist, pred);
01189 
01190     if (pred[t] == nil) return 0;
01191 
01192 //    I am checking that the shortest path from s to t is unique and I am marking all edges
01193 //    on the shortest path. The shortest path is unique if for every vertex on the shortest path there is only one incoming edge that defines the distance of the node. I am predict the potential for the nodes on the shortest
01194 //    path. The potential is the length of the path to t.
01195 
01196     int m_SP = 0;
01197 
01198     predicted_p[t] = 0;
01199     predicted_p[s] = D_st;
01200 
01201     v = t;
01202     while ( v != s) {
01203         edge e = pred[v];
01204         m_SP++;
01205         in_SP[e] = true;
01206         //used[e] = true;
01207         node w = G.opposite(e,v);
01208         //predicted_p[w] = predicted_p[v] + L[e];
01209         edge f;
01210         forall_inout_edges(f,v) {
01211             if ( f == e) continue;
01212             node z = G.opposite(f,v);
01213             if ( dist[z] + L[f] == dist[v]) return 0;
01214         }
01215         v = w;
01216     }
01217 // t is reachable from s and the shortest path from s to t is unique
01218 
01219     std::cout << "\n\nThe shortest s-t path consists of " << m_SP << " edges and has length " << D_st;
01220 
01221     simple_path path(0,s,list<edge>());
01222 
01223     list<simple_path> all_st_paths;
01224     construct_all_simple_paths(G,L,t,s,0,list<edge>(),all_st_paths);
01225 
01226     all_st_paths.sort(my_compare);
01227 
01228     forall(path,all_st_paths) {
01229         list<edge> cur_path = path.third();
01230 
01231         bool nothing_new = true;
01232         forall(e,cur_path)
01233         if ( predicted_p[G.source(e)] < 0 || predicted_p[G.target(e)] < 0 ) nothing_new = false;
01234 
01235         if (nothing_new) continue;
01236 
01237 
01238         std::cout << "\n\nsimple path of length " << path.first() << "   node sequence: ";
01239         v = s;
01240         forall(e,cur_path) {
01241             std::cout << " " << G[v];
01242             v = G.opposite(e,v);
01243         }
01244         std::cout << " " << G[t] << "\nwe are next decomposing this path.";
01245 
01246         while( true ) {
01247             list_item it;
01248             while (it = cur_path.first() ) {
01249                 edge f = cur_path[it];
01250                 if ( predicted_p[G.source(f)] >= 0 && predicted_p[G.target(f)] >= 0 )
01251                     cur_path.del_item(it);
01252                 else break;
01253             }
01254             // the first item is mixed or the current path is empty
01255 
01256             if ( cur_path.empty() ) break;
01257             e = cur_path[it];
01258             node start_node = ( predicted_p[G.source(e)] >= 0 ? G.source(e) : G.target(e));
01259 
01260             stack<edge> S;
01261             S.push(e);
01262             cur_path.del_item(it);
01263 
01264             NT Lsum = L[e];
01265             while (it = cur_path.first() ) {
01266                 edge e = cur_path[it];
01267                 if ( predicted_p[G.source(e)] < 0 && predicted_p[G.target(e)] < 0 ) {
01268                     S.push(e);
01269                     Lsum += L[e];
01270                     cur_path.del_item(it);
01271                 } else break;
01272             }
01273             // the first edge of cur_path is mixed.
01274 
01275             it = cur_path.first();
01276             e = cur_path[it];
01277             S.push(e);
01278             Lsum += L[e];
01279             cur_path.del_item(it);
01280 
01281             node goal_node =  ( predicted_p[G.source(e)] >= 0 ? G.source(e) : G.target(e));
01282 
01283             NT pot_diff = predicted_p[start_node] - predicted_p[goal_node]; // may be positive or negative
01284 
01285             v = goal_node;
01286             std::cout <<"\nnew path of length " << Lsum << " from " << G[goal_node];
01287             while (true) {
01288                 edge e = S.pop();
01289                 node w = G.opposite(e,v);
01290                 std::cout << " via " << G[w];
01291                 if ( w == start_node ) break;
01292                 predicted_p[w] = predicted_p[v] + pot_diff * L[e]/Lsum;
01293                 v = w;
01294             }
01295         }
01296     }
01297     return m_SP;
01298 }
01299 
01300 */
01301 
01302 
01303 //I am analysing the network
01304 NT analysis_of_network(const graph& G, int n, node s, node t, const edge_array<NT>& L,
01305                        const edge_array<bool>& in_SP,
01306                        const edge_array<bool>& e_in_G, const node_array<bool>& v_in_G,
01307                        const edge_array<NT>& D, const edge_array<NT>& Q, const node_array<NT>& p, NT D_st)  {
01308 
01309     std::cout << "\n\n\n\npotential of s = " << p[s] << " should converge to shortest path distance which is " << D_st;
01310     NT Ds = 0;
01311     node v;
01312     edge e;
01313     forall_inout_edges(e,s) Ds += D[e];
01314     std::cout << "\n\nconductivitiy of edges out of s = " << Ds << " should converge to I0 which is " << I0;
01315     node_array<NT> dist(G);
01316     node_array<edge> pred(G);
01317     NT PH_D_st = DIJKSTRA_T(G, s, t, e_in_G, L, dist, pred);
01318     assert (PH_D_st <= D_st);
01319     if ( PH_D_st > D_st ) std::cout<<"\n\nD_st = " << D_st << " PH_D_st = " << PH_D_st;
01320     NT minD_inSP = 1000;
01321     NT maxD_outsideSP = 0;
01322     forall_edges(e,G) {
01323         if ( in_SP[e] && D[e] < minD_inSP ) minD_inSP = D[e];
01324         if ( !in_SP[e] && (G.reverse(e) == nil || !in_SP[G.reverse(e)]) && D[e] > maxD_outsideSP ) maxD_outsideSP = D[e];
01325     }
01326     std::cout << "\n\nminD_inSP = " << minD_inSP << " should converge to I0; \nmaxD_outsideSP = (should converge to zero) " << maxD_outsideSP;
01327     std::cout.flush();
01328     return PH_D_st;
01329     //read_int("\ninput an integer to continue");
01330 }
